sen.j: 正親町三条公統（おおぎまちさんじょう きんおさ、寛文8年2月18日 (旧暦)（1668年3月30日） - 享保4年8月16日 (旧暦)（1719年9月29日）は、江戸時代前期から中期の公卿。
sen.e: Kinosa OGIMACHISANJO (March 30, 1668 - September 29, 1719) was a kugyo (court noble) during the early and the middle of the Edo period.
Kinosa OGIMACHISANJO (March 30, 1668 - September 29, 1719) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early and the middle of the Edo period.
Kinosa OGIMACHISANJO (March 30, 1668 - September 29, 1719) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early and the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 霊元天皇（112代）・東山天皇（113代）・中御門天皇（114代）の三帝にわたり仕えた廷臣で、官位は正二位大納言まで昇っている。
sen.e: He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served three emperors, Emperor Reigen (112th), Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and Emperor Nakamikado (114th) and rose to the official court rank of Shonii Dainagon (chief councilor of state in the Senior Second Rank).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served three emperors, Emperor Reigen (112th), Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and Emperor Nakamikado (114th) and was promoted to the official court rank of Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Chief Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 正二位大納言のカッコ内説明を用語集の表記に合わせました。rose -> was promoted
sen.e: He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served three emperors, Emperor Reigen (112th), Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and Emperor Nakamikado (114th) and was promoted to the official court rank of Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Chief Councilor of State).

sen.j: 父は参議正親町三条公廉。
sen.e: His father was Kinkado OGIMACHISANJO, sangi (councillor).
His father was Kinkado OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi (Councilor).
His father was Kinkado OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi (Councilor).
His mother is unknown.
His mother is unknown.
His mother is unknown.

sen.j: 養父に参議正親町三条実久（公廉の弟）。
sen.e: His foster father was Sanehisa OGIMACHISANJO, sangi (a younger brother of Kinkado).
His foster father was Sanehisa OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi (a younger brother of Kinkado).
His foster father was Sanehisa OGIMACHISANJO, Sangi (a younger brother of Kinkado).

sen.j: 養子縁組（滋野井公澄の子）に近衛府正親町三条実彦。
sen.e: Kinzumi SHIGENOI's son, Sanehiko OGIMACHISANJO, konoefu (a government official at the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards in the Senior Fourth Rank), was among the adopted sons of his family.
His adopted son was Sanehiko OGIMACHISANJO, a government official of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), the biological son of Kinzumi SHIGENOI.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: His adopted son was Sanehiko OGIMACHISANJO, a government official of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), the biological son of Kinzumi SHIGENOI.

sen.j: 養女（衛門府吉田兼敬の娘）に治部省穂波晴宣室がいる。
sen.e: His adopted daughter was the wife of 晴宣 HONAMI, Jibu-sho Ministry (the Ministry of Civil Administration), whose biological father was 兼敬 YOSHIDA, enofu (a government official at the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 「兼敬」と「晴宣」は読み方不明です。
sen.e: His adopted daughter was the wife of Harunobu HONAMI, a government official of Jibusho (the Ministry of Civil Administration), whose biological father was Kaneyuki (or Kanetaka) YOSHIDA, a government official of Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 吉田兼敬は「よしだかねゆき/かねたか」です。参照：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%90%89%E7%94%B0%E5%85%BC%E6%95%AChttp://www1.parkcity.ne.jp/sito/k131.html穂波晴宣は「ほなみはるのぶ」 です。参照：http://www1.parkcity.ne.jp/sito/k80.htmlJibu-sho -> Jibusho （近衛府と表記を合わせました）enofu -> Emonfu
sen.e: His adopted daughter was the wife of Harunobu HONAMI, a government official of Jibusho (the Ministry of Civil Administration), whose biological father was Kaneyuki (or Kanetaka) YOSHIDA, a government official of Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards).
The first name he was given was Kinmitsu.
He was firstly named Kinmitsu.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: He was firstly named Kinmitsu.
He was conferred a peerage in 1673.
He was conferred a peerage in 1673.
He was conferred a peerage in 1673.

sen.j: 以降累進して、侍従・近衛府・近衛府を歴任。
sen.e: After that, he gradually promoted from the member of Palace staff to konoefu.
sen.cmt: 近衛府が2度出てきていますが、訳は1つだけにしてあります。
sen.e: Later, he was gradually promoted from Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) to a government official of Konoefu.
sen.cmt: 侍従に定訳の補足説明を追記しました。Webでは「侍従・右近衛少将・右近衛中将を歴任」となっています。書き換える場合は下記になります。Later, he was gradually promoted from Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) to Ukone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Ukone no Chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.e: Later, he was gradually promoted from Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) to a government official of Konoefu.

sen.j: 元禄8年（1695年）父公廉の薨去を受けて正親町三条家を継いでいた叔父の実久も薨去したため、正親町三条家を相続した。
sen.e: As his uncle Sanehisa, who had inherited the family estate of the OGIMACHISANJO family after his father's death, died in 1695, Kinosa inherited the family estate.
As his uncle Sanehisa, who had succeeded to the Ogimachisanjo family after the death of Kinosa's father, died in 1695, he succeeded to the family estate.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: As his uncle Sanehisa, who had succeeded to the Ogimachisanjo family after the death of Kinosa's father, died in 1695, he succeeded to the family estate.

sen.j: 同年に参議となり、公卿に列している。
sen.e: He became sangi in the same year, position ranked with kugyo (court noble).
He became Sangi in the same year and joined Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 初出ではないため公卿の説明は削除しました。公卿は位ではないため、英文を書き換えました。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%85%AC%E5%8D%BF
sen.e: He became Sangi in the same year and joined Kugyo.

sen.j: その後、中納言を経て、正徳 (日本)元年（1711年）に大納言に就任している。
sen.e: After that, he became Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and in 1711, assumed the position of Dainagon (chief councillor of state).
Later, he became Chunagon (Vice-councilor of State), and in 1711, assumed the position of Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State).
Later, he became Chunagon (Vice-councilor of State), and in 1711, assumed the position of Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State).

sen.j: 正徳2年（1712年）には神宮伝奏に就任。
sen.e: He assumed the position of Jingutenso (shrine messenger to Emperor) in 1712.
In 1712, He undertook the position of Jingutenso (Shrine Messenger to Emperor).
In 1712, He undertook the position of Jingutenso (Shrine Messenger to Emperor).

sen.j: 享保2年（1717年）には踏歌節会内弁をつとめた。
sen.e: In 1717, he served as Toka no sechie Naiben (a kugyo who supervised inside Jomei gate at the (Imperial Court ceremony, called Toka no sechie).

In 1717, he served as Toka no sechie Later, he became Toka no sechie (Circle-Dancing Banquet: the last of the First Month's three great banquets [sechie] which formerly took place from the fourteenth to the sixteenth of January in the Shishinden [the Throne Hall] of the Imperial Court under the moonlight) Naiben (a Kugyo who supervised the Imperial Court Ceremony inside of Jomei Gate).
sen.cmt: 踏歌節会の説明を追記しました。内弁は下記を参照して訳を変更しました。http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn2/162643/m0u/
sen.e: In 1717, he served as Toka no sechie Later, he became Toka no sechie (Circle-Dancing Banquet: the last of the First Month's three great banquets [sechie] which formerly took place from the fourteenth to the sixteenth of January in the Shishinden [the Throne Hall] of the Imperial Court under the moonlight) Naiben (a Kugyo who supervised the Imperial Court Ceremony inside of Jomei Gate).

sen.j: 享保3年（1718年）に神宮伝奏を辞職。
sen.e: He resigned this position in 1718.
In 1718, he resigned the position as Jingutenso.
sen.cmt: this position -> 書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1718, he resigned the position as Jingutenso.

sen.j: 享保4年（1719年）には大納言も辞した。
sen.e: Also, in 1719, he resigned as Dainagon.
In 1719, he also resigned the position as Dainagon.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1719, he also resigned the position as Dainagon.
He died in the same year.
He died in the same year.
He died in the same year.
He was 52 years-old.
Died at the age of 52.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Died at the age of 52.
